content.heading: Introduction to PHP
copy: PHP (PHP: Hypertext Preprocessor) is an open-source, server-side scripting language for building interactive web pages and applications. Both WordPress and Drupal are written in PHP.
PHP files have the file extension .php
A PHP script is executed on the server, and plain HTML is returned to the browser. PHP scripts can be placed anywhere within a document and start with <?php before ending with ?>

copy: Below we have an example of a simple PHP script. We use the PHP built-in echo function to output 'Hello World' onto a web page.

content.heading: PHP Local Server
copy: PHP 5.4 and later have a built-in web server that can be used for local PHP development. You will need to open your terminal to run the server.

If successful, it should be possible to view your server in the browser at: http://localhost:8000. If you have a file named 'hello.php', for example, you would use the URL http://localhost:8000/hello.php
